tweet: Sorry, I would order @ ethereumJoseph not to do this, but he doesn't listen. These days I can't even get the guy to kick Deepak Chopra out of his conference. How dare he keep disobeying me like that... what does he think Ethereum is, a decentralized ecosystem?
One wins and the other loses. At least Ethereum's brand of sharding doesn't really change the single-chain status quo.

In Ethereum sharding, there's no notion of shards being mapped to specific long-term node clusters or geographies etc; it's not like there's a Shanghai shard, Toronto shard, etc. All shards take their (frequently reshuffled) validator sets from globally dispersed nodes.
See also: my somewhat longer reddit posthttps://www.reddit.com/r/ethereum/comments/8g1q55/vitalik_teases_sharding_release_on_twitter/dy85pq0/ …
